Financials are expected to lead the rally, with autos and technology also showing promise. Government spending on infrastructure, railways, and defence will be key drivers.

items.title: 7 smallcaps with upside potential of up to 54% to bet in 2026. How many do you own?
items.summary: In a recent report, the brokerage has identified seven smallcap stocks spanning utilities, financials and consumer discretionary that could offer value and potentially deliver returns of up to 54% over the next year.

items.title: Concurrent Gainers: 15 stocks gain for 5 days in a row
items.summary: Despite the modest market rally, 15 stocks from the BSE 500 index recorded gains in all five sessions.

items.title: IndiGo offering Rs 10,000 under ‘Gesture of Care’ offer. Here's who is eligible and how to claim the vouchers
items.summary: IndiGo has launched 'Gesture of Care' (GoC) to compensate passengers affected by significant flight disruptions from December 3-5, 2025. Eligible travelers will receive ₹10,000 in travel vouchers, split into two ₹5,000 vouchers, to ease the inconvenience caused by delays exceeding three hours.

items.title: Why silver is becoming a strategic metal in the green economy
items.summary: It benefits from being closely aligned with sustainability goals and infrastructure priorities, adding a layer of resilience to how it is viewed within long-term portfolios

items.title: BYD overtakes Tesla as world's largest EV seller in 2025
items.summary: The shift in market leadership follows a year where the American manufacturer recorded its first-ever decline in annual deliveries while its Chinese competitor reported significant growth in its electric segment

items.title: Buying ACs or cookware may get costlier as copper hits record highs
items.summary: Consumers may face higher prices for appliances, bathware and kitchenware in the new year due to a sharp surge in copper prices. Manufacturers are passing on increased input costs, with some appliance and cookware brands planning 5-7% price hikes. The bathware industry has already seen a 12% increase, with further rises expected.

items.title: BYD overtakes Tesla as worlds largest EV seller in 2025
items.summary: Chinese automaker BYD surpassed Tesla in full-year electric vehicle sales for the first time in 2025, securing its position as the world's largest electric vehicle seller, according to a Global Times report. The shift in market leadership follows a year where the American manufacturer recorded its first-ever decline in annual deliveries while its Chinese competitor reported significant growth in its electric segment.

items.title: Why watershed development is central to climate-resilient agriculture in India
items.summary: Watershed initiatives not only safeguard farming livelihoods but also contribute to broader environmental sustainability

items.title: India’s power demand recovery to fuel sector growth in 2026, Jefferies forecasts
items.summary: The anticipated recovery is linked to normalised weather patterns, increased industrial activity and the rising penetration of consumer durables, particularly cooling products

items.title: Tesla sales slip as it loses EV crown to China's BYD in 2025
items.summary: Tesla logged 418,227 deliveries in the final three months of the year, taking its full-year sales figure to around 1.64 million EVs

items.title: How did people invest their money in Rome or ancient Greece?
items.summary: Like today, people in ancient times understood that investing money could help them consolidate and increase their wealth

items.title: How weak origin rules are undermining India’s copper industry
items.summary: Only when rules of origin recognise substance over shape will trade policy truly align with India’s long-term economic interest

items.title: IPO Calendar: A quiet week with no mainboard activity, 3 SME issues to watch
items.summary: India's 2026 IPO market begins cautiously with no mainboard issues, focusing instead on three SME offerings in infrastructure, electric mobility, and textiles. Gabion Technologies, Victory Electric Vehicles, and Yajur Fibres are set to launch their public issues next week, aiming to raise funds for expansion and working capital amidst a typical slow start to the year.

items.title: 'Suited them and their political agenda': Entrepreneur Sanjeev Bikhchandani questions motive behind gig workers strike call
items.summary: Sanjeev Bikhchandani, founder of Naukri.com and Non-Executive Director of Eternal, once again expressed his support for Zomato Founder Deepinder Goyal on X regarding the welfare of gig workers following a recent strike call. Bikhchandani stated that discussions concerning delivery partner compensation and welfare remain a priority for the company's management and board, while taking a jab at the people who called for the strike.

items.title: Wall Street carries big expectations after best run since 2009
items.summary: Markets kicked off the new year with a strong rally, mirroring 2025's trend.  Investors saw big gains across stocks, bonds, and commodities, driven by AI enthusiasm and easing inflation.  However, this broad synchrony raises concerns about diversification's effectiveness and the sustainability of future returns, with some experts warning of anemic growth ahead.

items.title: Indian auto sector ends 2025 on strong note with decisive YoY growth: ACMIIL
items.summary: While sequential moderation was visible across most segments due to post-festive normalisation, the year-on-year trends remained exceptionally strong, signalling a healthy close to the last quarter of the calendar year

items.title: Wall Street Week Ahead-Jobs data could jolt stocks from holiday calm as 2026 kicks off
items.summary: The U.S. stock market anticipates a dynamic start to 2026, with crucial jobs data on January 9th poised to signal the Federal Reserve's next move on interest rates. Investors are also keenly awaiting Supreme Court decisions on tariffs and a new Fed chair, alongside the upcoming corporate earnings season.

items.title: Top hedge funds led by D.E.Shaw, Bridgewater and Balyasny deliver big gains in 2025
items.summary: Major hedge funds like D.E. Shaw and Bridgewater Associates achieved significant double-digit gains in 2025, fueled by an AI-driven stock market rally and global economic volatility.  These top performers navigated a year of record fluctuations, with some funds posting their highest profits ever, attracting substantial investor interest.

items.title: 5 world market themes for the week ahead
items.summary: Markets anticipate a busy start to the year. Key U.S. jobs data is due. OPEC+ meets on oil output. Commodity indexes rebalance. Initial public offerings are expected to increase. Investors remain optimistic despite potential risks from U.S. Supreme Court rulings and a new Federal Reserve chair announcement.

items.title: Berkshire Hathaway enters post-Buffett era as shares drift lower
items.summary: Berkshire Hathaway's post-Buffett era commenced with a slight dip in shares as Greg Abel assumed the CEO role. The conglomerate, now valued over $1 trillion, faces challenges finding needle-moving acquisitions amidst a record cash pile. Abel inherits a strong financial position, with Buffett remaining as chairman to support the transition.

items.title: India’s AI Outlook 2026: Accelerating innovation in agriculture and adjacent sectors
items.summary: The progress is shaped by incremental integration, institutional learning, and operational constraints alongside advances in technology

items.title: Dow closes higher on first day of 2026, still no Santa Claus rally
items.summary: Major indexes like the Dow and S&P 500 closed higher on Friday, ending a four-day losing streak to begin 2026. Chip makers, industrials, and utilities fueled the gains, while tech giants and consumer discretionary stocks saw declines.

items.title: ITC slides to three-year low as tobacco excise hike prompts brokerage downgrades
items.summary: ITC shares plummeted to a three-year low following a government excise duty hike on tobacco products. Brokerages downgraded the stock, citing fears of dampened cigarette demand and significant impact on profitability. Investors are advised to wait for clarity on price hikes and volume trends before considering buying.

items.title: Two executives quit IndusInd, bank fills key posts
items.summary: IndusInd Bank announced the resignations of two senior executives, Rana Vikram Anand and Anish Behl, who are leaving to explore new opportunities. Anand will depart in April 2026, while Behl's tenure concludes in January. These departures follow a series of senior-level exits, though the bank has simultaneously bolstered its leadership with recent appointments in wholesale banking, data, and human resources.

items.title: Bank holiday today: Are banks open or closed on Saturday, 3 January? Check state-wise holiday list
items.summary: Bank holiday on Saturday, 3 January: Banks remain open on the first, third and fifth Saturdays of every month, as per the bank holiday rules of the Reserve Bank of India.

items.title: Adani Enterprises to raise up to Rs 1,000 crore via NCDs
items.summary: Adani Enterprises is launching a public issue of non-convertible debentures to raise up to one thousand crore rupees. The issue offers various tenors and interest payment options. This fundraising aims to meet the company's financing needs, including refinancing and general corporate purposes. The debentures are rated CARE AA- and AA- (Stable) by respective agencies.

items.title: Sebi developing AI-driven tool to analyse cyber safety at entities
items.summary: Sebi is developing an AI-powered tool to analyze the cyber safety preparedness of regulated entities, aiming to strengthen risk-based supervision. Additionally, a working group is being formed to create a technology roadmap for market infrastructure institutions, ensuring innovation enhances market integrity.

items.title: Rupee down 22 paise to 90.20/dollar amid disappointing macro data
items.summary: The Indian rupee depreciated by 22 paise to settle at 90.20 against the US dollar on Friday. This decline was attributed to disappointing macroeconomic data, foreign fund outflows, and strong dollar demand from importers. However, weak crude prices and a surge in domestic equities provided some support.

items.title: Can Nifty sustain its momentum after scaling fresh all-time highs?
items.summary: Indian benchmark indices, Nifty50 and Sensex, closed at record highs on Friday, marking their best weekly gains in seven weeks. This surge followed a period of range-bound trading, with analysts predicting further upward movement.  Market participants anticipate significant gains for both indices in 2026, despite a cautious VIX.

items.title: Air India pilot removed from plane under influence of alcohol; Canada seeks investigation
items.summary: An Air India pilot was arrested at Vancouver International Airport on December 23rd while preparing for a flight to Delhi. Transport Canada warned the airline of potential flight authorization loss if alcohol consumption rules are not followed. The incident caused a significant delay to the flight, which eventually departed safely.

items.title: Aditya Vikram Birla: The industrial titan who outran the Licence Raj
items.summary: While his peers were busy petitioning the government for the right to grow, Aditya Vikram Birla did something far more subversive.

items.title: The week in charts: Sensex resilience, strong industrial output, new era in India-Australia trade
items.summary: In this weekly Plain Facts compilation, we present to you data-based insights, with easy-to-read charts, to help you delve deeper into the stories reported by Mint in the week gone by.

items.title: Shopping in 2026: AI is taking over my No. 1 hobby
items.summary: The Agentic era promises a friction-free life. But inconveniences build skills.

items.title: Warren Buffett says 'I'd rather have Greg Abel handling my money' as Berkshire Hathaway begins new era
items.summary: Berkshire Hathaway, under new CEO Greg Abel, faces challenges after Warren Buffett's departure. Analysts note Buffett's groundwork for a smooth transition, though uncertainty remains about sustaining the company's legacy.

items.title: Zomato's Deepinder Goyal's 5 points on gig workers' salaries, 10-minute delivery pressure: ‘Hardest challenge is…’
items.summary: Zomato's Deepinder Goyal explained how the gig model works and why 10-minute delivery promise does not put pressure on gig workers.

items.title: Banks want deposits but end up giving more loans
items.summary: A widening CD ratio is forcing banks to lean increasingly on market borrowings, liquidation of excess statutory liquidity ratio (SLR) holdings, and balance-sheet buffers to raise money for lending.

items.title: PRAGATI progress report: 3,300 delayed projects worth Rs 85 lakh crore fast-tracked
items.summary: PRAGATI has fast-tracked over 3,300 delayed projects worth Rs 85 lakh crore, resolving land, forest and clearance hurdles, and accelerating mega infrastructure works like the Kashmir rail link and Navi Mumbai airport.

items.title: Fans mourn closure of cupcake vending machine company Sprinkles Cupcakes
items.summary: Fans mourn closure of cupcake vending machine company Sprinkles Cupcakes

items.title: The new hot spots: Enterprise tech and deeptech lead PE's next wave
items.summary: This market shift signals a more discerning approach from investors, who are increasingly favouring control deals for deeper operational involvement and clearer exit strategies.

items.title: Russian oil discount for Indian refiners jumps to $8 a barrel
items.summary: Discount has increased from about $2 per barrel in October to up to $8 in January. The lower price of Urals crude will help India’s import bill as oil prices have tumbled about 20% in the past year to around $60 a barrel. About 88% of India's crude demand is met through imports.

items.title: Decade-old income tax demands resurface on portal, leaving taxpayers scrambling for proof
items.summary: Old income tax demands from as early as 2005 are resurfacing on tax portals, with accumulated interest often exceeding the principal amount. This digitisation effort has created a piquant situation, as taxpayers may challenge the validity of these demands due to potential issues with timely delivery of notices and assessment orders.

items.title: Golden Gate Capital Insurer PHL Veers to Liquidation as Rehab Hopes Fade
items.summary: State regulators are abandoning a plan to rehabilitate PHL Variable Insurance Co. and may pursue liquidation instead, after finding that the struggling life insurer — acquired by private equity firm Golden Gate Capital a decade ago — is in worse shape than previously thought.

items.title: Vi promoters earmark shares worth ₹3,529 cr to settle legacy liabilities
items.summary: Vodafone Idea's promoters will settle legacy merger liabilities worth ₹3,529 crore by earmarking 3.28 billion equity shares. This follows an amended agreement securing ₹5,836 crore, with ₹2,307 crore in cash and the rest via shares held by three Vodafone promoter entities. These shares, representing 3.03% of Vi's equity, will be sold over five years.

items.title: Vi promoters earmark shares worth ₹3,529 cr to settle legacy liabilities
items.summary: Vodafone Idea's promoters will settle legacy merger liabilities worth ₹3,529 crore by earmarking 3.28 billion equity shares. This follows an amended agreement securing ₹5,836 crore, with ₹2,307 crore in cash and the rest via shares held by three Vodafone promoter entities. items.title: ​Unenviable choice: On the government’s fiscal policy space
items.summary: Growth-generating capital expenditure can affect fiscal targets

items.title: Insurance a long game with hurdles, foreign investors unlikely to rush in
items.summary: India now permits full foreign ownership in insurance firms. However, industry experts believe this change will not immediately bring many new foreign companies. Setting up an insurer requires substantial investment and a long-term view in a competitive market. Existing joint ventures might see increased stakes, but new ventures from scratch are unlikely.

items.title: Insurance a long game with hurdles, foreign investors unlikely to rush in
items.summary: India now permits full foreign ownership in insurance firms. However, industry experts believe this change will not immediately bring many new foreign companies. Setting up an insurer requires substantial investment and a long-term view in a competitive market. Existing joint ventures might see increased stakes, but new ventures from scratch are unlikely.

items.title: Journeys not getaways: The Indian traveller now finds higher purpose in experience
items.summary: Indian travellers are embracing slower, more meaningful journeys. Expect growth in cultural, wellness, and nature-focused trips. Offbeat destinations and longer stays are becoming popular. AI will personalize travel planning. Value will be defined by experiences, not just price. This trend signals a new phase of travel growth.

items.title: 50 TV channels surrender licences in 3 years amid rising digital consumption
items.summary: Many Indian television channels are shutting down. Broadcasters are surrendering licenses as viewers move to digital platforms. This trend is driven by changing market conditions and financial challenges. Advertising revenue is also falling. This signals a major shift in India's media landscape.

items.title: PC demand may plunge 8% in 2026 amid rise in cost
items.summary: PC demand in India is set to drop by up to 8% in 2026. Consumers and gamers face higher prices for components like RAM. This surge is driven by AI data center needs. Businesses, however, are buying more PCs now to avoid future cost increases. Some buyers are opting for lower specifications with plans to upgrade later.

items.title: Niti Aayog drafts plan to shield senior citizens from digital scams
items.summary: India is preparing a policy road map to protect senior citizens from digital scams, with Niti Aayog working on a multi-ministerial action plan. The plan will focus on digital literacy, stronger security and coordinated monitoring as cases of ‘digital arrest’ fraud rise. The move will form part of broader elderly care measures, with details likely in Budget 2026-27.

items.title: India plans nationwide survey to map textile hubs, assess sector’s health
items.summary: India is preparing for a comprehensive nationwide survey of its vital textile industry. This initiative aims to map key textile hubs and assess the sector's overall health. The survey will collect data on financial inclusion, production value, worker conditions, and export performance. The findings will provide crucial insights into one of India's largest employment generators.

items.title: India announces ₹7,295 crore export credit support package to ease financing for exporters
items.summary: India has launched a significant export support package worth ₹7,295 crore. This initiative aims to make trade finance faster and cheaper for exporters. The package includes an interest subvention scheme and collateral support. These measures will be implemented over six years, starting from 2025. The goal is to boost India's exports by addressing critical trade finance challenges faced by businesses.

items.title: Body-worn cameras made mandatory for customs officers at airport Red Channels to boost transparency
items.summary: Customs officers at international airports' Red Channel are now mandated to wear body-worn cameras during passenger interactions. This move aims to boost transparency and accountability, with recordings stored for 90 days or longer for investigations. The initiative aligns with international best practices and addresses concerns about harassment.

items.title: Labour Codes may spur hiring as firms get more flexibility to restructure
items.summary: The new Labour Codes are expected to boost hiring by giving firms greater flexibility to restructure operations. The Industrial Relations Code raises the threshold for government approval for layoffs and closures to 300 workers from 100, easing compliance for MSMEs and mid-sized firms. Experts say labour-intensive sectors will benefit most, though some warn of higher labour turnover and income volatility.

items.title: India manufacturing PMI slows to two-year low in December, but sector ends 2025 on resilient note
items.summary: India's manufacturing sector experienced a slowdown in December, reaching a two-year low as new orders, output, and employment eased. Despite this, the industry concluded 2025 on a resilient note, with strong demand expected to sustain activity. While export orders saw a dip, manufacturers anticipate future growth, though business sentiment has softened.

items.title: Weighted average lending rates on fresh rupee loans rise to 8.71% in November as state-run banks hike rates
items.summary: Lending rates on fresh rupee loans rose by 10 basis points to 8.71% in November 2025, driven by state-run banks. This increase reflects rising bond yields and sluggish deposit growth, hindering the full pass-through of policy rate cuts to borrowers despite RBI's aggressive easing.

items.title: RBI continues to build forex reserves which rose to $696 billion
items.summary: India’s forex reserves rose by $3.3 billion to $696.61 billion in the week ended December 26, RBI data showed. The increase was led by a sharp $2.95 billion jump in gold holdings and a modest rise in foreign currency assets. Reserves remain near record highs, providing cover for 9–10 months of imports amid global volatility.

items.title: RBI continues to build forex reserves which rose to $696 billion
items.summary: India’s forex reserves rose by $3.3 billion to $696.61 billion in the week ended December 26, RBI data showed. The increase was led by a sharp $2.95 billion jump in gold holdings and a modest rise in foreign currency assets. Reserves remain near record highs, providing cover for 9–10 months of imports amid global volatility.

items.title: Credit continues to beat deposit growth, PSU banks proforma numbers show
items.summary: State-run banks saw steady balance sheet growth in the December quarter, with loans continuing to grow faster than deposits. Average credit growth was about 14%, compared with deposit growth of nearly 11%, highlighting ongoing funding pressures. Brokerages expect loan growth to stay strong, supported by retail and MSME demand, despite persistent challenges in deposit mobilisation.

items.title: Centre designates core customs and indirect tax digital platforms as “critical information infrastructure” under IT Act
items.summary: The Indian government has designated core customs and indirect tax digital platforms, including ICEGATE, ECCS, and ACES-GST, as "critical information infrastructure." This move significantly enhances cybersecurity controls and restricts access to authorized personnel only. Unauthorized access to these protected systems now carries criminal penalties under the Information Technology Act.

items.title: Deepinder Goyal reveals Zomato delivery partners' average income amid gig economy debate: Here's how much they earn
items.summary: Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal released a fact sheet on delivery partners' earnings after YouTuber Dhruv Rathee raised questions about the company's pay practices.&nbsp;

items.title: LIC launches special campaign to revive lapsed individual policies
items.summary: Life Insurance Corporation of India announces a special revival campaign for lapsed policies. This drive runs from January 1 to March 2, 2026. It offers attractive concessions on late fees for non-linked policies. Micro insurance policies receive a 100 percent waiver. The campaign aims to help policyholders restore their insurance cover.

items.title: PM Modi reviews progress on acquisition of critical mineral assets abroad, sops for domestic recycling
items.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi reviewed critical mineral asset acquisitions overseas. He also assessed a Rs 1,500-crore incentive scheme promoting critical mineral recycling. These efforts aim to secure supply chains for modern industries and support India's energy transition. The National Critical Mineral Mission is driving self-reliance and green energy goals.

items.title: Tesla loses title as world's biggest electric vehicle maker as sales fall for second year in row
items.summary: Chinese rival BYD, which sold 2.26 million vehicles last year, is now the biggest EV maker

items.title: Sebi tightens screws on merchant bankers with phased net-worth requirements, liquidity norms
items.summary: Sebi has introduced a phased hike in net-worth and liquid capital norms for merchant bankers starting January 2026, alongside tighter underwriting limits, governance standards and revenue thresholds. The move aims to strengthen market intermediaries amid India’s booming IPO pipeline, ensuring stronger compliance, better capital buffers and improved investor protection.

items.title: Gig economy: Info Edge co-founder Sanjeev Bikhchandani sides with Zomato's Deepender Goyal - 'Every word is true'
items.summary: Over two days, Deepinder Goyal took to X with a series of posts defending the gig-worker model. He argues that the much-debated 10-minute delivery promise is only possible in areas with a high density of stores around residences.

items.title: Entities in Bangladesh, Bhutan, Nepal can directly buy coal from CIL
items.summary: Earlier, access to Coal India Ltd's (CIL) dry fuel by consumers across the borders was only through domestic coal traders who were allowed to buy and sell without any end-use restrictions.

items.title: Punjab National Bank's global business rises 9.57 percent in Q3
items.summary: Punjab National Bank reported strong growth in its third quarter business. Global business reached Rs 28.92 lakh crore, a 9.57% increase year-on-year. Domestic business also saw a rise of 9.09%. Deposits and advances both showed healthy year-on-year growth. The bank's shares closed higher on Friday.

items.title: NTPC in talks to buy minority stake in U.S.-based nuclear tech firm CCTE
items.summary: The U.S.-based company has developed a patented thorium and enriched uranium nuclear fuel called ANEEL. It claims that the fuel is compatible with existing pressurised heavy water reactors (PHWR)/Canada Deuterium Uranium (CANDU) reactors

items.title: What will shape India’s core industries in 2026: The themes redefining growth
items.summary: India’s core industries are transforming as the nation advances toward Viksit Bharat. In 2026, technology-led reinvention, sustainability, and talent transformation are key drivers. AI, smart systems, and digitalization are reshaping manufacturing, energy, healthcare, and finance, while companies focus on low-carbon operations and workforce upskilling.

items.title: Indira IVF, Chartered Speed, Jerai Fitness among 8 IPOs approved by Sebi
items.summary: Sebi has cleared eight companies, including Indira IVF, Chartered Speed, Glass Wall Systems, Shriram Food Industry, RKCPL, Tempsens Instruments, Jerai Fitness and Rays of Belief, to proceed with IPO plans. The approvals span healthcare, mobility, infrastructure and consumer sectors, signalling steady regulatory momentum ahead of an expected listing window in 2026.

items.title: Zomato's Deepinder Goyal responds to Dhruv Rathee, agrees to share fact sheet on gig workers' average hourly earnings
items.summary: Deepinder Goyal said he will share a fact sheet on average hourly earnings of the company's delivery partners after YouTuber Dhruv Rathee challenged his statement and demanded transparency.&nbsp;

items.title: Lokapriya Gopinath Bardoloi International Airport, Guwahati saw remarkable passenger growth in 2025
items.summary: Guwahati’s Lokapriya Gopinath Bardoloi International Airport (LGBIA), managed by Adani Airport Holdings, saw strong growth in 2025, handling 7.01 million passengers, including 90,897 international travelers. The airport set a single-day record of 22,089 passengers on October 5 and expanded international routes to Paro, Bangkok, and Singapore, boosting aircraft movements to 47,550 domestic and 1,000 international ATMs.

items.title: Aequitas Investment founder Siddhartha Bhaiya passes away at 47
items.summary: A chartered accountant, Bhaiya founded Aequitas in 2012, “to break free from the conventional ways of wealth generation” of investors

items.title: Banks’ credit growth outpaces deposit growth in Q3 FY26
items.summary: ICRA revises its projection of credit expansion in FY26 to ₹19.5-21.0 trillion (10.7–11.5%) from its earlier estimate of ₹19-20.5 trillion (10.4-11.3% y-o-y growth)

items.title: Devyani-Sapphire merger will create a more resilient QSR platform: analysts
items.summary: This comes at a time when a large number of QSR players have been witnessing a softer demand environment.

items.title: Stock markets start 2026 strong: Nifty at lifetime high, Sensex rallies 0.7%
Sensex at 40 reflects India’s market evolution from manual trades to global integration: Sebi Chairman
items.summary: Sebi Chairman Tuhin Kanta Pandey said the Sensex’s 40-year journey mirrors India’s transformation from manual, inward-looking markets to a globally integrated, technology-driven ecosystem. Speaking at a BSE event, he highlighted how the index’s evolving composition reflects shifts in industry, governance, innovation and long-term value creation across decades.

items.title: Govt. extends time for textile PLI scheme
Withdrawal of PM E-DRIVE scheme makes electric 3-wheelers costlier, but unlikely to impact sentiment
items.summary: The Centre said since the scheme has fulfilled the required objective, claims under the scheme will not be entertained beyond December 26

items.title: Hindustan Zinc mined metal production rises, saleable silver output drops in Q3
items.summary: Hindustan Zinc Ltd has announced a four percent increase in mined metal output for the third quarter of the current fiscal year. This rise is attributed to higher ore production. Saleable metal production also saw a four percent jump. Refined zinc and lead output contributed significantly to this growth. Silver production experienced a slight dip.

items.title: Coal India clears decks for buyers from Bangladesh, Nepal and Bhutan to join e-auctions directly
items.summary: Under the revised framework, foreign buyers can now participate alongside domestic buyers in SWMA auctions.

items.title: Varanasi draws record 7.26 crore tourists in 2025, says UP govt
items.summary: Varanasi recorded a surge in tourism in 2025, with more than 7.26 crore visitors, according to the Uttar Pradesh government. The state said infrastructure upgrades, including the Kashi Vishwanath Corridor, beautification of Ganga ghats, temples and roads, and improved tourist facilities, have helped turn the spiritual city into a major global tourism hub.

items.title: Export Promotion Mission: Govt rolls out interest subvention, collateral guarantee for exporters
items.summary: Subvention of 2.75% on export credit for MSME exporters; collateral guarantee up to 85% for micro, small exporters, 65% for medium exporters

items.title: Cupid Q3 update: Company expects December quarter to be best-ever, guides for over Rs 335 cr FY26 revenue
items.summary: Cupid expects Q3 FY26 to be its best-ever quarter, driven by strong demand and smooth execution. The company said its order book is at a record high and expressed confidence in surpassing its FY26 revenue and profit guidance. Capacity expansion and new FMCG products are also progressing as planned.

items.title: 'Agents of political interests': Zomato's Deepinder Goyal shares video of assault on delivery boy during strike
items.summary: The Zomato CEO claimed that some delivery workers were stopped from working on Christmas and New Year's Eve due to a strike, adding that many of these protestors were not even delivery partners. Here's what he said.&nbsp;

items.title: KPI Green Energy begins power supply from 92-MW hybrid project in Gujarat
items.summary: The project was awarded by Gujarat Urja Vikas Nigam Limited under the competitive bidding process for hybrid renewable energy projects, KPI Green Energy Limited said in an exchange filing.

Centre ready to offer PRAGATI platform to States for faster execution of projections

items.title: Tesla loses title of world's biggest EV maker to China's BYD as sales fall for 2nd year in row
items.summary: Tesla has been dethroned as the world's top EV maker by Chinese rival BYD, with sales declining for a second consecutive year. This downturn is attributed to customer backlash over Elon Musk's politics, expiring U.S. tax credits, and intense global competition. Despite these challenges, investors remain optimistic about Tesla's future in robotaxis and humanoid robots.

items.title: Soaring silver forces Chinese PV panel makers to mull price hike in Q1
items.summary: China is dominating the global solar panel manufacturing sector, producing over 80% of the world’s panels, cells

items.title: Mutual funds investors miss overseas markets boom
items.summary: The asset under fund of funds (FoF) of MFs investing in global markets increased 28% to ₹35,965 crore in November, against ₹28,065 crore in January due to mark-to-market gains.

items.title: Watch: Explained: What are Supplementary Demands for Grants?

This relies on a fair bit of estimation. Once about 8-9 months are past, the government is in a much better state to have an accurate idea of how much it is going to spend in the year. So, in December, it submits what is known as a Supplementary Demand for Grants if it needs more money.

items.title: Automation threatens 69% jobs in India: World Bank
items.summary: "In large parts of Africa, it is likely that technology could fundamentally disrupt this pattern. Research based on World Bank data has predicted that the proportion of jobs threatened in India by automation is 69 percent, in China it is 77 percent and in Ethiopia, the percentage of jobs threatened by automation is 85 percent," he said.
